witness.desc: 'var0' is the first variant text/line listed in Dickinson's manuscript.
'var1' is the second variant text/line listed in Dickinson's manuscript.
'var2' is the third variant text/line listed in Dickinson's manuscript.

lg.l: Before I got my eye put out — ,
I liked as well to see —
As other Creatures, creatures that have Eyes— Eyes eyes,
And know no other way — .
But were it told to me , Today, —Today— , to-day,
That I might have the Sky sky
For mine , — I tell you that my Heart heart
Would split, for size of me — .

app.rdg: The meadows mine, the mountains mine,—

lg.l: As much of noon, as I could take— Noon as I could take noon as I could take
Between my finite Eyes— eyes— eyes.

app.rdg: The Motions of the Dipping Birds—
The motions of the dipping birds,

lg.l: The Lightning's jointed Road— lightning's jointed road, Morning's Amber Road—

app.rdg: For mine—to look at when I liked
For mine to look at when I liked,

lg.l: The news News would strike me dead — ! !
So safer—guess— So, safer, guess, with just my soul
Upon the window pane Window pane— window-pane
Where other Creatures creatures put their Eyes eyes— eyes,

Incautious —
of the Sun— sun.
Of nearness to her Sundered Things sundered Things sundered things
The Soul has special times — ,

When Dimness —
looks the Oddity— oddity, Oddity,
The Shapes shapes we buried, dwell about, buried dwell about buried dwell about.

Familiar ,
in the Rooms— rooms,
Untarnished by the Sepulchre, sepulchre sepulcher
In just the Jacket that he wore— jacket that he wore,
Long buttoned in the Mold mold,

app.rdg: Since we, old mornings, children played,
The Grave yields back her Robberies—
The grave yields back her robberies,

lg.l: Salute us , with their wings—

app.rdg: As we it were that perished,
Themself—had just remained till we rejoin them—
Till we rejoin them, and 'twas They
And't was They, and not Ourselves

lg.l: Tie the Strings strings to my Life, My life, my Lord,

app.rdg: Then, I am ready to go!
Then I am ready to go!

lg.l: Just a look at the Horses horses horses —
Rapid! That will do!

Put me in on the firmest tightest highest—
side— side,
For we must ride to the Judgment — ,

app.rdg: And it's many a mile—the Hills—

lg.l: But never I never I mind the steepest Bridges steepest— bridges,

app.rdg: And never I mind the Sea—
And never I mind the sea;

lg.l: Held fast in Everlasting Race— everlasting race

app.rdg: By my own Choice, and Thee—
By my own choice and thee.
Goodbye to the Life I used to live—
Good-by to the life I used to live,
And the World I used to know—
And the world I used to know;
And kiss the Hills, for me, just once—
And kiss the hills for me, just once;

lg.l: Then— Now I am ready to go!

app.rdg: And it's many a mile—the Hills
Here's a keepsake for the Hills

lg.l:
He I showed me Hights her Hights her heights
I she never saw—
" Would'st Climb Would'st Climb, Wouldst climb? " —He said? I said? I said,
I said, She said— She said "Not so"—

"With
me— me— me? " He said— I said— I said,
"With me"? With me? "With me?"

He I showed me her
Secrets— secrets
The Rope the rope that Nights were put across—

app.rdg: "And now, Would'st have me for a Guest"?
"And now—"Would'st have me for a Guest"?
And now, "Wouldst have me for a Guest?"

lg.l: I She could not find my "Yes". her Yes— her yes—
And then, He I brake His Life—And lo, my life—And Lo, my life, and Lo!
A light for me, Light, for her, light for her, did solemn glow — ,

app.rdg: The steadier, as my face withdrew—
The larger, as her face withdrew—

lg.l:
And could I further "No"?
could she, futher, "No"? could she, further, "No?"

I like a look of Agony agony
,
Men do not sham Convulsion convulsion ,

Nor simulate
a Throe— , a Throe— a throe.
The Eyes glaze once —and—that is Death— , and that is death. —and that is Death—
Impossible to feign
By homely Anguish anguish strung.
I felt a Funeral, in my Brain, funeral in my brain,

app.rdg: Kept treading, treading, till it seemed

lg.l: And when they all were seated,
Kept beating—beating— beating, beating, till I thought
And then I heard them lift a Box box,
With those same Boots of lead, again, boots of lead, again.
As all the Heavens were a Bell, heavens were a bell,

app.rdg: And I, and Silence, some strange Race
And I and silence some strange race,

lg.l: And then a Plank in Reason, broke,
And I dropped down, and down—
And hit a World, at every plunge, Crash—
And Finished Got through— knowing—then—
'Tis so appalling—it exhilarates—
So over Horror, it half Captivates— it dumb fascinates—
The Soul stares after it, secure—

app.rdg: To know the worst, leaves no dread more—
A Sepulchre, fears frost, no more—

lg.l: To scan a Ghost, is faint—
Suspense kept sawing so—
The Truth, is Bald, and Cold—
But that will hold—
If any are not sure—
We show them—prayer—
But we, who know,
Stop hoping, now—
Looking at Death, is Dying—
Just let go the Breath—
And not the pillow at your Cheek
So Slumbereth—
Others, Can wrestle—
Yours, is done—
And so of Woe, bleak dreaded—come,
It sets the Fright at liberty—
And Terror's free—
Gay, Ghastly, Holiday!

app.rdg: How noteless Men, and Pleiads, stand,
How noteless men and Pleiads stand

lg.l: Until a sudden sky
Reveals the fact that One is rapt one is wrapt
Forever from the Eye— eye.
Members of the Invisible,
Why didn't we detain Them? retain Them? detain it? detain them?
The Heavens with a smile, smile
When we stand on the tops of Things— things
And like the Trees, look down— trees look down,
The smoke all cleared away from it— it
And Mirrors on the scene— [sunset] on the scene
Just laying light—no light, no soul will wink

The Sound ones, like the Hills sound ones like the hills
—shall stand— —stand up— shall stand

No Lightning, lightning
scares away— drives away— drives away.
The Perfect, nowhere be afraid— perfect nowhere be afraid,
They bear their

When others, dare not others dare not
go at Noon, walk at noon, go at noon,
Protected by their deeds— deeds.
The Stars stars dare shine occasionally
Upon a spotted World— world,

app.rdg: And Suns, go surer, for their Proof,
And suns go surer for their proof,

lg.l: As if An Axle, held— A Muscle—held an axle held.
'Twas just this time, last year, I died. time last year I died.
I know I heard the Corn, corn,
When I was carried by the Farms— farms,—
It had the Tassels on— tassels on.
I thought how yellow it would look— look
And then, then I wanted to get out,
But something held my will.
I thought just how Red—Apples wedged red apples wedged
And Carts went And carts went And the Carts stooping round the fields
To take the Pumpkins in— in.
I wondered which would miss me, least, me least,
And when Thanksgiving, came, Thanksgiving came,
If Father'd father'd multiply the plates— plates
To make an even Sum— sum.

app.rdg: And would it blur the Christmas glee
And if my stocking hung too high,
Would it blur the Christmas glee,
For any Santa Claus to reach
That not a Santa Claus could reach

lg.l: The Altitude of me— altitude of me?
But this sort, grieved myself, sort grieved myself, and so

app.rdg: And so, I thought the other way,
I thought how it would be

lg.l: How When just this time, some perfect year— year,
Themself, Themselves should come to me— me.
Afraid! Afraid? Of whom am I afraid?
Not Death—for who is He? death; for who is he?
The Porter porter of my Father's Lodge father's lodge
As much abasheth me ! .
Of Life? 'Twere odd I fear thing a thing [a] thing
That comprehendeth me
In one or two existences— more—existences more existences

app.rdg: Just as the case may be—

lg.l: Of Resurrection resurrection ? Is the East east
Afraid to trust the Morn morn
With her fastidious forehead?
As soon impeach my Crown crown !
